files.README.md:
# Claude Code Plugin Marketplace

Personal collection of Claude Code plugins including skills, agents, hooks, and MCP configurations.

## Installation

Add this marketplace to Claude Code:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add jason-hchsieh/marketplace
```

Then install individual plugins:

```bash
/plugin install <plugin-name>@jasonhch-plugins
```

## Available Plugins

### Language Servers

| Plugin | Description | Source |
|--------|-------------|--------|
| typescript-lsp | TypeScript/JavaScript language server for Claude Code | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/typescript-lsp) |
| pyright-lsp | Python language server (Pyright) for Claude Code | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/pyright-lsp) |
| rust-analyzer-lsp | Rust language server for Claude Code | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/rust-analyzer-lsp) |
| clangd-lsp | C/C++ language server (clangd) for Claude Code | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/clangd-lsp) |

### Code Review & Quality

| Plugin | Description | Source |
|--------|-------------|--------|
| code-review | Automated code review for pull requests using multiple specialized agents | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/code-review) |
| pr-review-toolkit | A comprehensive collection of specialized agents for thorough pull request review | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/pr-review-toolkit) |
| code-simplifier | Identifies opportunities for code simplification and refactoring | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/code-simplifier) |
| security-guidance | Security guidance and best practices for Claude Code | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/security-guidance) |

### Development Workflow

| Plugin | Description | Source |
|--------|-------------|--------|
| feature-dev | A comprehensive, structured workflow for feature development with specialized agents | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/feature-dev) |
| commit-commands | Streamline your git workflow with simple commands for committing, pushing, and creating pull requests | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/commit-commands) |
| ralph-loop | Implementation of the Ralph Wiggum technique for iterative, self-referential AI development loops | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/ralph-loop) |
| gitea | Gitea integration via tea CLI and gitea-mcp server for managing repositories, issues, and pull requests | Local |
| conductor | Context-Driven Development plugin with structured workflow: Context → Spec & Plan → Implement | [wshobson/agents](https://github.com/wshobson/agents/tree/main/plugins/conductor) |
| documentation-generation | Documentation generation skills including ADRs, changelog automation, and OpenAPI spec generation | [wshobson/agents](https://github.com/wshobson/agents/tree/main/plugins/documentation-generation) |

### Search & Discovery

| Plugin | Description | Source |
|--------|-------------|--------|
| mgrep | A calm, CLI-native way to semantically grep everything, like code, images, pdfs and more | [mixedbread-ai/mgrep](https://github.com/mixedbread-ai/mgrep) |
| context7 | Upstash Context7 MCP server for up-to-date documentation lookup | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/external_plugins/context7) |

### Claude Code Configuration

| Plugin | Description | Source |
|--------|-------------|--------|
| hookify | Easily create hooks to prevent unwanted behaviors by analyzing conversation patterns | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/hookify) |
| claude-md-management | Tools to maintain and improve CLAUDE.md files - audit quality, capture session learnings, and keep project memory current | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/claude-md-management) |
| claude-code-setup | Analyze codebases and recommend tailored Claude Code automations - hooks, skills, MCP servers, and more | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/claude-code-setup) |
| claude-mem | Persistent memory system that captures sessions, compresses with AI, and injects relevant context into future sessions | [thedotmack/claude-mem](https://github.com/thedotmack/claude-mem/tree/main/plugin) |
| continuous-learning | Automatically extract reusable patterns from sessions and evolve them into skills | Local |
| plugin-dev | Comprehensive toolkit for developing Claude Code plugins with skills for hooks, MCP, commands, and agents | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/plugin-dev) |

### Output Styles

| Plugin | Description | Source |
|--------|-------------|--------|
| explanatory-output-style | Recreates the deprecated Explanatory output style as a SessionStart hook for educational insights | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/explanatory-output-style) |
| learning-output-style | Combines Learning output style with explanatory functionality for active, hands-on coding engagement | [claude-plugins-official](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official/tree/main/plugins/learning-output-style) |

## Structure

```
marketplace/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── marketplace.json      # Marketplace catalog
├── plugins/
│   └── <plugin-name>/
│       ├── .claude-plugin/
│       │   └── plugin.json   # Plugin manifest
│       ├── skills/           # Skills (recommended)
│       ├── agents/           # Subagents
│       ├── hooks/            # Event hooks
│       └── .mcp.json         # MCP server configs
├── CLAUDE.md
├── README.md
└── LICENSE
```

## Creating a Plugin

1. Create a plugin directory under `plugins/`
2. Add `.claude-plugin/plugin.json` manifest
3. Add your components (skills, agents, hooks, MCP configs)
4. Register the plugin in `.claude-plugin/marketplace.json`

See [CLAUDE.md](CLAUDE.md) for detailed component formats.

## References

- [Claude Code Plugins Documentation](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/plugins)
- [Plugin Marketplaces](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/plugin-marketplaces)
- [Skills](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/skills)

## License

MIT
files.plugins/continuous-learning/README.md:
# Continuous Learning Plugin

Automatically extract reusable patterns from sessions and evolve them into skills.

## Concept

When Claude discovers something non-trivial - a debugging technique, a workaround, a project-specific pattern - that knowledge should be captured as a reusable "instinct" rather than re-explained each session.

## Features

- **Session analysis** via Stop hook
- **Instinct extraction** with confidence scoring
- **Pattern evolution** into skills, commands, or agents
- **Import/Export** for sharing learned patterns

## The Instinct Model

An instinct is an atomic learned behavior:

| Property | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| Trigger | When this instinct applies |
| Action | What to do when triggered |
| Confidence | Reliability score (0.3-0.9) |
| Domain | Category (error, workflow, convention, etc.) |
| Evidence | What happened to create this instinct |

## Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/learn` | Extract patterns from current session |
| `/instinct-status` | Show all learned instincts |
| `/evolve` | Cluster instincts into higher-order skills |
| `/instinct-export` | Export instincts for sharing |
| `/instinct-import` | Import instincts from export file |

## Storage Structure

```
.claude/learning/
├── instincts/           # Individual learned patterns
│   ├── imported/        # Instincts from imports
│   └── archived/        # Evolved instincts
├── evolved/             # Higher-order artifacts
│   ├── skills/          # Generated skills
│   ├── commands/        # Generated commands
│   ├── agents/          # Generated agents
│   └── conventions.md   # Learned conventions
├── observations/        # Session observation logs
└── exports/             # Exported instinct packages
```

## Workflow

```
Sessions → Observations → Instincts → Evolution → Skills/Commands/Agents
```

1. **Work normally** - Claude observes patterns during sessions
2. **Extract patterns** - Use `/learn` at session end
3. **Accumulate instincts** - Patterns build up over time
4. **Evolve** - Use `/evolve` when clusters form

## Confidence Scoring

| Score | Meaning |
|-------|---------|
| 0.3-0.4 | Observed once, might be situational |
| 0.5-0.6 | Observed pattern, likely useful |
| 0.7-0.8 | Strong pattern, auto-approve threshold |
| 0.9 | Highly reliable, verified multiple times |

## Evolution Types

Instincts can evolve into:

- **Skill** - Comprehensive SKILL.md with guidance
- **Command** - Slash command for specific workflows
- **Agent** - Specialized subagent for complex tasks
- **Convention** - Rule to add to CLAUDE.md

## Configuration

Edit `config.json` to customize:

```json
{
  "min_session_length": 10,
  "confidence": {
    "minimum": 0.3,
    "auto_approve": 0.7
  },
  "patterns_to_detect": [...],
  "ignore_patterns": [...]
}
```

## Privacy

- Observations stay local on your machine
- Only patterns (instincts) can be exported
- Raw code and conversations are never shared

## Based On

This plugin implements concepts from:
- [Everything Claude Code - Continuous Learning](https://github.com/affaan-m/everything-claude-code)
- The "Homunculus v2" instinct-based learning architecture
files.plugins/gitea/README.md:
# Gitea Plugin

Gitea integration for Claude Code via tea CLI and gitea-mcp server.

## Features

- **tea CLI**: Official Gitea command-line interface for managing issues, PRs, repos, and more
- **gitea-mcp**: MCP server providing 80+ tools for direct Gitea integration

## Installation

### tea CLI

| Platform | Command |
|----------|---------|
| macOS | `brew install tea` |
| Arch Linux | `pacman -S tea` or `yay -S gitea-tea` |
| Ubuntu/Debian | Download binary from https://dl.gitea.com/tea/ |
| Windows | `scoop install tea` or download binary |
| Alpine | `apk add tea` |
| Docker | `docker pull gitea/tea` |

**Local install (no sudo):**
```bash
# Download the latest release for your platform
curl -L -o tea https://dl.gitea.com/tea/<version>/tea-<version>-<platform>-<arch>
chmod +x tea
mv tea ~/.local/bin/
```

### gitea-mcp

Download the binary from https://gitea.com/gitea/gitea-mcp/releases

| Platform | Installation |
|----------|--------------|
| All platforms | Download binary, extract, add to PATH |
| Local install | `mv gitea-mcp ~/.local/bin/` |
| Build from source | `git clone https://gitea.com/gitea/gitea-mcp.git && make install` |

**Local install (no sudo):**
```bash
# Download the latest release for your platform
curl -L -o gitea-mcp.tar.gz https://gitea.com/gitea/gitea-mcp/releases/download/<version>/gitea-mcp-<version>-<platform>-<arch>.tar.gz
tar -xzf gitea-mcp.tar.gz
chmod +x gitea-mcp
mv gitea-mcp ~/.local/bin/
```

## Configuration

### Environment Variables

| Variable | Required | Description |
|----------|----------|-------------|
| `GITEA_ACCESS_TOKEN` | Yes | Personal access token from Gitea |
| `GITEA_HOST` | No | Gitea instance URL (default: https://gitea.com) |

### Generate Access Token

1. Go to your Gitea instance
2. Navigate to Settings > Applications
3. Generate a new token with appropriate scopes
4. Set the token: `export GITEA_ACCESS_TOKEN=your_token`

### tea CLI Authentication

```bash
# Add a login (interactive)
tea login add

# List configured logins
tea login list

# Set default login
tea login default <name>
```

## Usage

### With tea CLI

```bash
# List issues
tea issue list

# Create a pull request
tea pr create --title "Title" --description "Description"

# Clone a repository
tea repo clone owner/repo
```

### With gitea-mcp (via Claude Code)

The MCP server provides tools for:
- Repository management (create, fork, list, search)
- Issues and PRs (CRUD, comments, reviews)
- Branches, tags, and releases
- File operations (read/write)
- Actions (workflows, secrets, runs)
- Organizations and teams
- Wiki pages

## Resources

- [tea CLI Repository](https://gitea.com/gitea/tea)
- [tea Documentation](https://docs.gitea.com/usage/command-line)
- [tea Downloads](https://dl.gitea.com/tea/)
- [gitea-mcp Repository](https://gitea.com/gitea/gitea-mcp)
- [gitea-mcp Releases](https://gitea.com/gitea/gitea-mcp/releases)
